body_html:
Good point @Enet4! I am using the PREVIEW1 JNI but I compiled the TensorFlow jar from source in order to get the latest changes (including this one). Is there currently a way to build the JNI from source? The only option I see in the readme is https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/java#quickstart step number 2.

The saved_model API is more recent, but to my understanding, it does not invalidate the other one.

This makes sense! I will start using saved_model.

body:
Good point @Enet4! I am using the **PREVIEW1** JNI but I compiled the TensorFlow jar from source in order to get the latest changes (including this one). Is there currently a way to build the JNI from source? The only option I see in the readme is https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/java#quickstart step number 2.

> The saved_model API is more recent, but to my understanding, it does not invalidate the other one.

This makes sense! I will start using `saved_model`.
